summary: This is an email sent on August 23, 2023, from an individual to the NHS Subject Access team at Guy's and St Thomas' NHS Foundation Trust. The sender urgently requests their medical records from August 2008, when they were hospitalized after an incident they attribute to trauma suffered from Jeffrey Epstein. The records are needed for ongoing litigation related to Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the person who sex trafficked the email sender, whose trauma led to a hospitalization in 2008.

connections.description: The email sender identifies as a survivor who was sex trafficked by Jeffrey Epstein, and states their hospitalization was due to trauma suffered at his hands.

events.title: Sender's Hospitalization
events.description: The email sender was rushed to A&E and stayed in the ICU in a coma for roughly a month, an event they attribute to trauma from Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Urgent Medical Records Request
events.description: The email sender contacts the NHS to urgently request their 2008 hospital records for use in ongoing Jeffrey Epstein-related litigation.

locations: Guy's and St Thomas' NHS Foundation Trust (GSTT)
A&E (Accident & Emergency department, implied to be at GSTT)
ICU (Intensive Care Unit, implied to be at GSTT)
keyFacts: An individual identifies themself as a survivor who was sex trafficked by Jeffrey Epstein.
The sender claims that trauma from Epstein led to a medical emergency on or around August 16, 2008, requiring roughly a month-long coma in the ICU.
The sender is involved in ongoing litigation related to Jeffrey Epstein and needs their 2008 medical records as evidence.
The request for records is extremely urgent, with a deadline of only a few days from August 23, 2023.
The correspondence is directed to the NHS Subject Access team, indicating the records are held by a UK hospital trust.
